com.github.randomcodeorg.ppplugin.ppdefaults.logging

Class AndroidLogAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.randomcodeorg.ppplugin.ppdefaults.logging.AndroidLogAdapter

  • public class AndroidLogAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
    An adapter to call the methods of android.util.Log. This implementation might be a little slow because it uses reflection to call the corresponding methods. You can create and use a inheriting class that calls the required methods directly. See the documentation of
    • v(String)
    • d(String)
    • i(String)
    • w(String)
    • e(String)
    • getTag()
    to do so.
    Author:
    Marcel Singer

    • Method Detail

      • getTag

        public static java.lang.String getTag(java.lang.Class<?> runtimeClass)

      • getTag

        protected java.lang.String getTag()
        Returns the tag to be used. One can use the result of this method to call the android.util.Log directly within an inheriting class.
        Returns:
        The tag to be used.

      • d

        public void d(java.lang.String message)
        Creates a debug-level log entry. One can override this method to call the android.util.Log directly. You can get the required tag by calling getTag().
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be logged.

      • e

        public void e(java.lang.String message)
        Creates an error-level log entry. One can override this method to call the android.util.Log directly. You can get the required tag by calling getTag().
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be logged.

      • i

        public void i(java.lang.String message)
        Creates an information-level log entry. One can override this method to call the android.util.Log directly. You can get the required tag by calling getTag().
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be logged.

      • v

        public void v(java.lang.String message)
        Creates a verbose-level log entry. One can override this method to call the android.util.Log directly. You can get the required tag by calling getTag().
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be logged.

      • w

        public void w(java.lang.String message)
        Creates a warning-level log entry. One can override this method to call the android.util.Log directly. You can get the required tag by calling getTag().
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be logged.
